qas.question: Who was the first distinctive Whig party that emerged from the chaos?
Who was the leader of the Rockingham Whigs?
What was the description for the basic framework of the Rockingham Whigs party?

answers.text: "a body of men united for promoting by their joint endeavours the national interest, upon some particular principle in which they are all agreed"

qas.question: Did the Rockingham Whigs ever regain power as a opposition to the government?

answers.text: remained out of power as a united opposition to government.

qas.question: Who was the Bedfordite faction tied to that made them unstable?
How long did Edmund Burke remain a philosopher?
What group was lead by Edmund Burke?
What happened when Edmund Burke was removed from power?

plausible_answers.text: "a body of men united for promoting by their joint endeavours the national interest, upon some particular principle in which they are all agreed".

qas.question: What description was the basic framework for government created by Chathamite factions?

context: When they lost power, the old Whig leadership dissolved into <b5_0>a decade<b5_0/> of <b7_0>factional chaos<b7_0/> with distinct "Grenvillite", "Bedfordite", "Rockinghamite", and "Chathamite" factions successively in power, and all referring to themselves as "Whigs". Out of this chaos, the first distinctive parties emerged. The first such party was <a0_0>the <b6_0>Rockingham Whigs<b6_0/><a0_0/> under the leadership of <a1_0>Charles Watson-Wentworth<a1_0/> and the intellectual guidance of the political philosopher Edmund Burke. Burke laid out a philosophy that described the basic framework of the political party as <a2_0><b8_0>"a body of men united for promoting by their joint endeavours the national interest, upon some particular principle in which they are all agreed"<a2_0/>.<b8_0/> As opposed to the instability of the earlier factions, which were often tied to <b4_0>a particular leader<b4_0/> and could disintegrate if removed from power, the party was centred around a set of core principles and <a3_0>remained out of power as a united opposition to government.
